intro: Selinum candollei, commonly known as the giant selang or giant selinum, is a striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Andes mountains of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, feathery leaves that can reach several feet in length. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. Selinum candollei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
